item.title: Binding of Isaac is Getting an Online Co-Op Mode as Part of the 10th Anniversary Update
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/binding-of-isaac-online-co-op-mode-10th-anniversary-update/

According to the latest announcement by Binding of Isaac creator Edmund McMillen, the title will receive a full online co-op mode, including completion markers for its 10th-anniversary update. The online co-op mode is scheduled to arrive on November 18, 2024. The game will also receive a ‘considerable balance update’, which will look towards buffing items the community has found to be “lacklustre/bad”. 

Binding of Isaac is celebrating its 10th anniversary with a massive 50% discount on Steam and discounts on all DLCs. 

Edmund McMillen and Nicalis, Inc. developed Binding of Isaac: Rebirth, which was released in 2014. It is an action RPG shooter with a heavy focus on rogue-like elements. Players follow Isaac’s journey as he battles gangs of deranged enemies, lost brothers and sisters, fears, and eventually his mother. 

The game features shooter gameplay in randomly generated environments. As Isaac, players will find mysterious treasures that provide the character with superhuman abilities and other skills to conquer more difficult enemies and explore unreachable areas. Rebirth is a remake of the original title with a new game engine, all-new hand-drawn pixel-style artwork, highly polished visual effects, an all-new soundtrack and more.

item.title: Dragon Age Remaster Unlikely, Creative Director Says
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/dragon-age-remaster-unlikely-creative-director-says/

Dragon Age: The Veilguard is out and it’s been a well received game overall. It’s launch 10 years after the last mainline Dragon Age game has had people wondering if the original games could get the remaster treatment.

While Creative Director John Epler would like it to happen, he doesn’t see it likely. In an interview with Rolling Stone around the game’s launch, Epler was asked about seeing the first three games remastered in some way.

“I think I’m one of about maybe 20 people left at BioWare who’s actually used Eclipse,” Epler told the outlet. “It’s something that’s not going to be as easy as Mass Effect, but we do love the original games. Never say never, I guess that’s what it comes down to.”

While he does say “never say never”, the technology of the original games could prove a sticking point. The first two Dragon Age games from 2009 and 2011 were built with the custom Eclipse engine. The third game, Dragon Age: Inquisition ultimately moved to the Frostbite Engine, making it more likely for a remaster than the others.

Rolling Stone mentioned the Mass Effect games getting remastered. Those games were built on Unreal Engine, making it an easier task to bring forward with newer technology.

If it were to happen, it would almost be a certainty that the first two games would have to be built from scratch in Frostbite, or a different engine.

item.title: Elon Musk is Somehow a Top 20 Diablo 4 Player
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/elon-musk-top-20-diablo-4-player/

If you spend any amount of time online, specifically on X (formerly Twitter), then you know Elon Musk enjoys the sound of his own voice. More specifically, the look of his opinions in text format, as the man tweets constantly. It’s downright amazing how he has time for anything else besides posting online. Still, in his spare time, he’s quickly risen through the ranks to become a top 20 Diablo 4 player—one of only two in the United States. It’s absolutely shocking and entirely true.

It’s well known that Elon Musk plays video games. It wasn’t long ago that players online tore apart his Elden Ring build, after all, but he appears to favor RPGs with grind involved. In Diablo 4, he’s previously complained about how overpowered Barbarians are, and as a Barb main, please cry about it, Elon. Oh, but he plays a Barbarian primarily. Go figure!

During his appearance on the Joe Rogan podcast, Musk kickstarted the conversation by bragging about becoming one of the top 20 Diablo 4 players in the world. He’s one of only two Americans currently on the list, with the other topping the leaderboards in the number one spot. Currently, Musk sits in 19th.

Now, this ranking revolves around Pit runs. He’s achieved the 19th best timed run through Pit 150, which is an absolutely challenging grind and, honestly, a little impressive.

Instead of playing his usual Barbarian, Musk ranked with the new Spiritborn class, part of the Vessel of Hatred expansion. Furthermore, he’s running a Quill build.

Alongside Diablo 4 and Elden Ring, Musk is also a long-time fan of Cyberpunk 2077.

Do you think Musk managed to hit the leaderboards in Diablo 4 legitimately or not? Let us know in the comments below!

On the topic of Elon Musk, did you know he’s considered one of the most successful streamers ever? He broke records in a single hour!

item.title: Nintendo Switch Sells Over 146 Million Units
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/nintendo-switch-sells-over-146-million-units/

Nintendo Switch has released its dedicated video game unit sales, and the Switch has managed to cross the 145 million mark. 

According to the financial report, Nintendo Switch has now sold 146.04 million units of hardware and 1,306.10 million units of software. However, it’s not all good news for Nintendo. According to the report, hardware sales were down 31.0% (4.72 million), and software sales were down 27.6% (70.28 million) year-on-year. 

In terms of other Nintendo Hardware, the Wii U has sold 13.56 million units, the Wii has sold 101.63 million units, the DS with 154.02 million, the Game Boy Advance has sold 81.51 million units, the Game Boy has sold 118.69 million units, the GameCube sold 21.74 million units, Nintendo 64 sold 32.93 million units, the SNES sold 49.10 million units and the NES sold 61.91 million units. 

In terms of Nintendo Switch software sales, new games like Paper Mario Thousand-Year Door have sold 1.94 million units since May 2024, Luigi’s Mansion 2 HD has sold 1.57 million units since June, and  The Legend of Zelda: Echoes of Wisdom has sold 2.58 million units since September. Mario Kart 8 Deluxe also sold 2.31 million units during this period, bringing the cumulative sales to 64.27 million units. 

In other news, Nintendo says that the Switch 2 will still be announced before April 2025. Also, the online playtest program for the console was recently datamined. item.title: Your First Look at Planet Coaster 2 Achievements and How to Unlock Them
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/planet-coaster-2-achievements-unlock-them/

If you’re as excited as I am about Planet Coaster 2, then you’ll likely want to check out the achievements coming to the creative park building and management game. There aren’t too many, but enough to challenge you and keep you working toward a goal beyond the most beautiful park imaginable.

All Planet Coaster 2 Achievements and How to Unlock Each

The clear majority of Planet Coaster 2 achievements revolve around progressing through the game’s story mode, completing various challenges, and exploring the game’s core mechanics. They don’t appear overly tricky to unlock, so I’m confident you can 100% the game this year.

Is There a Planet Coaster 2 Platinum Trophy on PS5?

As Planet Coaster 2 launches simultaneously on PC and PlayStation 5, along with the Xbox Series X|S, it does indeed have a platinum trophy to unlock. It’s called “Heir to the Throne,” and of course, requires you to unlock all other trophies in the game to acquire.

It’s quite the challenge, but savvy fans with experience in previous “Planet” titles should have no issue meeting the unlock requirements for each of the above-mentioned Planet Coaster 2 achievements and trophies!

item.title: Pokemon TCG Pocket Has Already Earned Over $12 Million
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/pokemon-tcg-pocket-has-already-earned-over-12-million/

Pokemon TCG (Trading Card Game) Pocket is off to a solid start, raking in over $12 million within 4 days of release. 

According to data provided by AppMagic (via mobilegamer.biz), Pokemon TCG Pocket earned $3 million per day during the opening weekend, accumulating a sum of $12 million within just four days. The game was released on the iOS App Store and Android Play Store on October 30, and since then, it has amassed over 10 million downloads globally. 

Pokemon TCG Pocket is an application that allows you to enjoy your card-collecting and trading passion digitally. The game is available in 89 countries worldwide, allowing players to open packs, collect cards, battle other players, and more. The collection features nostalgic illustrations as well as some completely new ones that have been specifically designed for the game. 

Players can open two booster packs for free each day; they also have the option to showcase their collections in files and boards to share them with the world. A new Pokemon card experience has been designed explicitly for TCG Pocket, which features ‘Immersive Cards’ with three-dimensional illustrations. Lastly, it features battles that are easy to understand and don’t take too long. 

In other news, check out how to get ‘Flair’ in Pokemon Pocket TCG. Also, Game Freak leaks revealed an ‘adult’ Pokemon movie and a new anime in production.
